html: The bill empowers #Medicare to negotiate for lower prescription drug costs Those under the age of 65 would have the option to enroll in a public health insurance option called Medicare X This new option WOULDN'T interfere with the existing Medicare system for Americans 65+
text:
The bill empowers #Medicare to negotiate for lower prescription drug costs
Those under the age of 65 would have the option to enroll in a public health insurance option called Medicare X
This new option WOULDN'T interfere with the existing Medicare system for Americans 65+

html: For too many Americans, limited #healthcare competition in their area has driven up prices & made quality coverage unaffordable. Today, I’m proud to back the Medicare-X Choice Act, a bill that would increase choice & competition, lower premiums, & lower drug costs for #VA07.

html: Past tragedies have made it horrifically clear what can happen when we choose to divide, classify, and target others based on their religion, or skin tone, or accent. Our visit to the @VaHolocaust Museum reminded me of why I am proud to be an original cosponsor on the #NoBanAct.
text: Past tragedies have made it horrifically clear what can happen when we choose to divide, classify, and target others based on their religion, or skin tone, or accent. Our visit to the @VaHolocaust Museum reminded me of why I am proud to be an original cosponsor on the #NoBanAct.

html: These common elements are EVERYWHERE in modern America, not just in our history books.
text: These common elements are EVERYWHERE in modern America, not just in our history books.

html: Look at the story of the Gross Breesen students – the anxiety about whether they have the skills needed to relocate. The rise of hatred & persecution against a religious minority. The persistent battle to obtain a visa. The depth of patriotism for an adopted nation.
text: Look at the story of the Gross Breesen students – the anxiety about whether they have the skills needed to relocate. The rise of hatred & persecution against a religious minority. The persistent battle to obtain a visa. The depth of patriotism for an adopted nation.

html: The @VaHolocaust Museum does the critically important work of teaching us about the past, but they also bring these issues into the present. Human rights violations are occurring every day, in every corner of the globe.
text: The @VaHolocaust Museum does the critically important work of teaching us about the past, but they also bring these issues into the present. Human rights violations are occurring every day, in every corner of the globe.

html: During our visit, we also spent time with a Holocaust survivor and heard his family’s compelling story of survival. I had met him previously, but this was the first time I had the opportunity to hear his entire story. It is a chance I am deeply thankful for.
text: During our visit, we also spent time with a Holocaust survivor and heard his family’s compelling story of survival. I had met him previously, but this was the first time I had the opportunity to hear his entire story. It is a chance I am deeply thankful for.

html: The Gross Breesen students and the Thalhimer family remained in contact for many years.
text: The Gross Breesen students and the Thalhimer family remained in contact for many years.

html: Hyde Farmlands was eventually sold, but the students went on to serve in the U.S. military as soldiers and linguists during the war. Some of them experienced the liberation of Buchenwald concentration camp, where they themselves had been prisoners just a few years before.
text: Hyde Farmlands was eventually sold, but the students went on to serve in the U.S. military as soldiers and linguists during the war. Some of them experienced the liberation of Buchenwald concentration camp, where they themselves had been prisoners just a few years before.

html: In 1939-1940, after a lengthy legal battle, the Thalhimer family of Richmond succeeded in securing visas for 21 Gross Breesen students. On the eve of World War II, these Jewish students arrived in Central Virginia from Germany and founded Hyde Farmlands.
text: In 1939-1940, after a lengthy legal battle, the Thalhimer family of Richmond succeeded in securing visas for 21 Gross Breesen students. On the eve of World War II, these Jewish students arrived in Central Virginia from Germany and founded Hyde Farmlands.

html: In 1936, the German Jewish community created an agricultural training institute called Gross Breesen to teach Jewish young people skills they might need to successfully flee the country as the Nazis gained power.
text: In 1936, the German Jewish community created an agricultural training institute called Gross Breesen to teach Jewish young people skills they might need to successfully flee the country as the Nazis gained power.

html: #EqualPay is one of the clearest ways we can support working families in #VA07. On average, Virginia women make just 78 cents for every $1 a man makes doing the same job. That gap makes it harder for working families to cover rent, medical bills, & childcare costs. #EqualPayDay

html: This week, I’ll be voting in support of a full #VAWA reauthorization, because we must reaffirm that all women should be protected from violence. This legislation would improve services for survivors, and it would empower our law enforcement to protect Central Virginia families.
text:
This week, I’ll be voting in support of a full #VAWA reauthorization, because we must reaffirm that all women should be protected from violence. 

This legislation would improve services for survivors, and it would empower our law enforcement to protect Central Virginia families.

html: We can narrow the rural-urban health gap by strengthening federal investment in rural health programs, protecting Medicare and Medicaid, and investing in infrastructure that improves #rural residents’ access to healthcare providers. #VA07 #NPHW
text: We can narrow the rural-urban health gap by strengthening federal investment in rural health programs, protecting Medicare and Medicaid, and investing in infrastructure that improves #rural residents’ access to healthcare providers. #VA07 #NPHW

html: Today for #NPHW, I want to draw attention to the unique public health challenges facing #rural communities in #VA07. html: Constitutionally, it is Congress that has the authority to appropriate money, and the President’s efforts to sidestep that authority and the checks and balances process that authority represents is deeply concerning. (4/4)
text: Constitutionally, it is Congress that has the authority to appropriate money, and the President’s efforts to sidestep that authority and the checks and balances process that authority represents is deeply concerning. (4/4)

html: Additionally, the president’s unilateral action of declaring a national emergency actually jeopardizes our national security by pulling critical funding from our military. (3/4)
text: Additionally, the president’s unilateral action of declaring a national emergency actually jeopardizes our national security by pulling critical funding from our military. (3/4)

html: Notably, it comes after Congress successfully conducted bipartisan, bicameral negotiations that resulted in the passage of a bipartisan appropriations bill last night—legislation that funds the government and provides for border security investments. (2/4)

text: 17- We must demonstrate a willingness to collaborate and compromise as we serve the people we were elected to represent.

html: 16- We are indeed stronger as a country when Congress and the President work together to move us forward, and our challenges are simply too large to sit idle in our corners.
text: 16- We are indeed stronger as a country when Congress and the President work together to move us forward, and our challenges are simply too large to sit idle in our corners.

html: 15- This commitment to bipartisan engagement includes pushing to prevent another senseless government shutdown. I support discussions about strengthening our security, but we can do so without shuttering the government and subjecting the federal workforce to additional pain.
text: 15- This commitment to bipartisan engagement includes pushing to prevent another senseless government shutdown. I support discussions about strengthening our security, but we can do so without shuttering the government and subjecting the federal workforce to additional pain.

html: 14- We need to focus on substantive, evidence-based policy—not just rhetoric. During my first month in Congress, I’ve participated in bipartisan discussions on issues as vital as the security of our borders and ports of entry, including at the White House.
text: 14- We need to focus on substantive, evidence-based policy—not just rhetoric. During my first month in Congress, I’ve participated in bipartisan discussions on issues as vital as the security of our borders and ports of entry, including at the White House.

html: 13-However in Central Virginia, I have heard from many farmers about the negative effects of the ongoing trade war. As we approach planting season, farmers desperately need certainty, & I hope the administration will help provide the necessary assistance to sustain farm families.
text: 13-However in Central Virginia, I have heard from many farmers about the negative effects of the ongoing trade war. As we approach planting season, farmers desperately need certainty, & I hope the administration will help provide the necessary assistance to sustain farm families.

html: 12- As a member of the @HouseAgDems, I wanted to hear more from the President about his priorities for our rural communities. In his speech, the President did discuss ongoing trade negotiations between the United States and China.
text: 12- As a member of the @HouseAgDems, I wanted to hear more from the President about his priorities for our rural communities. In his speech, the President did discuss ongoing trade negotiations between the United States and China.

html: 11- And as a member of the @HouseForeign Affairs Committee, I will continue to stress the vital work of the diplomatic and intelligence communities, because I am concerned about the President’s continued criticism of these dedicated public servants.
text: 11- And as a member of the @HouseForeign Affairs Committee, I will continue to stress the vital work of the diplomatic and intelligence communities, because I am concerned about the President’s continued criticism of these dedicated public servants.

html: 10- By championing strong global partnerships, we can continue to keep our communities safe.
text: 10- By championing strong global partnerships, we can continue to keep our communities safe.

html: 9- President Trump also addressed our national security priorities. As a former CIA case officer, I will continue to support a robust national security strategy, and we need to make sure this strategy includes working with our allies to promote global stability.
text: 9- President Trump also addressed our national security priorities. As a former CIA case officer, I will continue to support a robust national security strategy, and we need to make sure this strategy includes working with our allies to promote global stability.

html: 8- While I agree with this priority, we must also protect reliable healthcare coverage for millions of Americans, including those with pre-existing conditions.
text: 8- While I agree with this priority, we must also protect reliable healthcare coverage for millions of Americans, including those with pre-existing conditions.

html: 7- The President also rightfully discussed the staggering costs of prescription drugs. We need to work together to reduce prices, because working families, the elderly, and the disabled should never have to choose between remaining healthy and putting food on the table.
text: 7- The President also rightfully discussed the staggering costs of prescription drugs. We need to work together to reduce prices, because working families, the elderly, and the disabled should never have to choose between remaining healthy and putting food on the table.

html: 6- Last week, I called on House leadership to prioritize infrastructure improvements, so we can repair roads and bridges, strengthen broadband internet access, and modernize transportation networks.
text: 6- Last week, I called on House leadership to prioritize infrastructure improvements, so we can repair roads and bridges, strengthen broadband internet access, and modernize transportation networks.

html: 5- I agree that we must promote job growth and economic development by investing in infrastructure in Central Virginia and across the country.
text: 5- I agree that we must promote job growth and economic development by investing in infrastructure in Central Virginia and across the country.

html: 4- Tonight, President Trump advocated for increased bipartisanship—and I hope he intends to follow through on this commitment with concrete actions. In his speech, the President spoke about the need to pursue a bold, bipartisan infrastructure package.

html: And H.R. 211, led by @RepSchrader, would reduce the rate of pay for Members of Congress if a shutdown occurs— because if the House, in concert with the Senate and POTUS, cannot keep our government open, officials shouldn’t expect a full taxpayer-funded paycheck until they do.
text: And H.R. 211, led by @RepSchrader, would reduce the rate of pay for Members of Congress if a shutdown occurs— because if the House, in concert with the Senate and POTUS, cannot keep our government open, officials shouldn’t expect a full taxpayer-funded paycheck until they do.

html: H.R. 67, led by @RepDonBeyer, is a bipartisan bill that would require that federal employees unpaid during the shutdown would receive their pay once the shutdown ends. The havoc caused by the shutdown is bad enough, but ensuring federal employees receive their salaries is vital.
text: H.R. 67, led by @RepDonBeyer, is a bipartisan bill that would require that federal employees unpaid during the shutdown would receive their pay once the shutdown ends. The havoc caused by the shutdown is bad enough, but ensuring federal employees receive their salaries is vital.

html: These two bills would make sure: 1. Federal workers receive backpay once the shutdown ends, and 2. Member of Congress don't receive their regular salaries in a shutdown.
text:
These two bills would make sure: 

1. Federal workers receive backpay once the shutdown ends, and 

2. Member of Congress don't receive their regular salaries in a shutdown.

html: And because I feel strongly that federal employees and the very function of our government should not be bargaining chips, on my first day in Congress, I also co-sponsored two bills that would help address this increasingly serious situation.
